title: TFT isn't RNG BASED HUH!!
body: > How is this possible and why is this even a thing? Explain rito. The number 1 dude only has 5 3*

replies.body:
These are $1 and $2 units.
Your team has an average cost of about 4, think about that.

> [{quoted}](name=LordRedStone Nr1,realm=EUW,application-id=RaE1aOE7,discussion-id=JQB1x8L4,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-09-10T10:12:08.692+0000)
>
> These are $1 and $2 units.
> Your team has an average cost of about 4, think about that.

I understand that but you are basically saying it should be that easy to get that many 3*? That is what I’m an interpreting from your statement.  Plus the higher level you are the less likely you are to roll 1 cost units.  I’m not saying your wrong, but I do not think it should be that easy to get that many 3* units.

It is. There are 3 times as many cards of Tier 1 as there are Tier 4.

So not only are you paying double, you're also paying double for a card that is three times as rare.

How do you know it was "that easy"?
This is certainly uncommon, but think about the monkeys with typewriters or the numbers of Pi.
Given enough games, any constellation may happen, however unlikely it is. I don't think he can pull this off any game, but it's certainly possible that he DID pull it off in yours.

You also said he had most of them before the other people were out.
That kinda contradicts your statement above that one wouldn't get the low-level units with a higher level. He most likely got them at a lower level.

It means he had better econ than anyone else, looked at what others weren't buying, and bought them.
No one else bought Gangplank. 
Only 2 people bought Lucian (OMFG)
Fiora's a common. (3 bought)
Garen's a common (3 bought)
Only 1 person bought Graves.

You were buying expensive units of whom don't even have that many synergies. Phantom? (2) Knight? (3 Yordle)? You're lucky you got #2 due to your Cho and Kindred.

RNG has a role. It doesn't dictate who wins.

The top player in TFT has 2 accounts in the top 10:

DeliciousMilkGG and MilkGG

I took what I could get my rolls were all over the place and my items were the same. I was fighting from the bottom  but I do understand what you are saying. I just wanted to make a point that it shouldn’t be that easy to get that many 3* and he had most of them before the last 4 players were even out.

You took what you "Thought" you could get from your rolls because you couldn't predict future rolls. I've given up a 3 Star Round 3 Veigar before, because I was hunting Imperials/Demons, which is what I thought the cards were giving me.

Settle on a composition meta, and try to build that every game, and you'll find that suddenly, "I was given that" every game.

Sometimes I have to get down to 1-11 HP before I win the game at round 4-5, because my team hasn't assembled itself while I was econing. But it usually does get assembled, and then I kill off the top 6 who are left.

I guarantee you had an option to steal Garens/Fioras from him. You probably could have stopped the Gangplank 3 star too. And the Lucian. But you decided to build brawlers/champs with global skills.

It can be really frustrating sometimes when I'm sitting there with 1 level 2 Fiora and a bunch of level 1s vs a guy who had 4 level 2s, one of them being Shyvana (with 3 attack speed items. :P) and a level ahead plus the same gold as me and I've not even rolled once.

Just the nature of the game sometimes.
